content.question: Which of the following requires the use of implicit differentiation to find <math alttext="the derivative of y, with respect to x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="2 y plus, 3 times x squared, minus x, equals 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="y equals, e raised to the 3 plus x power, plus x cubed" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="y equals, e raised to the y plus x power, plus x cubed" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="y equals, the fraction with numerator x to the fourth power, plus 3, and denominator 4 times x cubed, minus 2, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="y equals, e raised to the y plus x power, plus x cubed" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 3: Differentiation: Composite, Implicit, and Inverse Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the classification of a given expression (e.g., Use the chain rule to find the derivative of a composite function).
